page.title: 10Grizedale
page.content:
At Grizedale there is a Theatre, campsite, tree nursery, museum and a Forestry Commission Office.
{The campsite}has been open for 23 years, it accommodates 60 tents. Dutch people like camping at Grizedale because it is nice and quiet. It costs adults Â£1.50 per night. If you want to see the area you can hire a bike. The campsite is on the site of the old Grizedale Hall which was demolished in 1957.
{The Theatre in the Forest}dates from 1969 and has plays, dancing, jazz, classical and folk music, and talks. The average price of tickets is about Â£2.00 per person. The Theatre Trust has over 1000 members, and they hope that their theatre will continue to be used for many years.
